name: github_scenario_add_a_requirement_document_to_the_repository_for_a
description: Test case for: As a user, I want to add a requirement document to the repository for a customer management system.

parts.text: add a requirement document to the repository for a customer management system.

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

Since we're creating a requirements document for a customer management system, we'll initialize the repository with the appropriate Cyoda template and then add the requirements file into the functional requirements directory so it’s tracked and reviewable. Before I can save anything, please choose how you'd like the repository and branch to be created.

[options-single-choice: Python — Public repo — New Branch, Python — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Python — Private repo — New Branch, Python — Private repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Public repo — New Branch, Java — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Private repo — New Branch, Java — Private repo — My Existing Branch]
